job.title: Data Scientist - Global Supply Chain
job.industry: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing,Information Technology and Services,Computer Software
job.description:
Job Description
The Global Supply Chain Operation’s (GSCO) Demand Forecast Data Science Analyst is responsible for providing complex analytics for information across ON Semiconductor. This information is primarily in the areas of Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP) and Demand Management (DM) related processes. These complex analytics should lead directly to efficiencies, improved processes, and improved results across GSCO, and additionally to ON Semiconductor’s Business Units and Sales Organization by virtue or working on S&OP and DM processes.
What You’ll Do
Implement and Drive Process and System Enhancements related to S&OP and DM Processes
Implement complex analytics which lead business users to increased business efficiencies
Implement company time-series statistical forecast processes of end customer demands through advance regression, clustering, boosting, and some emerging machine learning techniques
Implement processes which improve overall company demand forecasts as measured by key forecasting metrics (MAPE, MAD, MPE, Tracking Signal, Bias, …)
To provide information and guidance to help Business Unit Demand Managers and Sales in managing their forecasts
To insure that demand data flows properly across onsemi Supply Chain systems
To provide complex analytics on data and information as requested by GSCO management
To provide efficient and flexible reporting infrastructures / reports for all information as it relates to demands within the company
Provide information to help drive onsemi's Demand Review and Executive Demand Review meetings as part of the S&OP Processes
To manage onsemi's Demand Management Application tools
To manage all requests as they relate to Demand Management and S&OP process and data improvements.
To document as needed Demand Management and S&OP Processes and Systems for training, education, communication, and process improvement purposes.
The ability to analyze information from multiple systems, compare that information, draw conclusions, and take action based upon the information.
The ability to implement advanced modeling techniques, from Supervised Learning (Regression, Classification), to Unsupervised Learning (Clustering), and Ensemble and Boosting methodologies.
The ability to implement the immediately above listed techniques towards time series forecasting.
Advanced data analytical skills across multiple platforms and environment. With special emphasis on the ability to analyze very large amounts of data. This will be done in multiple programming languages and environments but primarily by making use of the R Programming language, along with other complementary languages as needed such as SQL, Python, Perl, Java, PL/SQL, and Unix/Linux shell scripting as needed.
Advanced analytical skills in Qlikview (reporting framework / application).
A strong understanding of Planning, Supply Chain, Demand Management, S&OP, and Operations information within the Semiconductor Industry.
A BS/BA/MS/MBA in Industrial Engineering, Supply Chain, Econometrics or equivalent work experience.
The ability to focus and learn key systems in detail over time (especially Kinaxis Rapid Response).
Strong Leadership and Interpersonal Skills
Strong Communication and Teaching Skills
Ability to Conduct Detailed Data Analysis and Data Coordination across Different Systems
Ability to Translate Business Requirements into Technical Solutions
Ability to Project the Impact of Decisions
Ability to Evaluate Technical Capabilities and Relate Them to Business Solutions
Experienced in Working with various Software Systems
Process-driven, goal-focused, collaborative, and the ability to multi-task.
The ability to work well within a team which spans multiple groups, and to think independently.
